HDG.BC.content: the appearance of freedom in calculation: servitude under dominion of constantly “needed,” i.e. utility: freedom & magnificence of consumption (Nutzniessung) & its increase
HDG.BC.linkedContent: the appearance of freedom in calculation: servitude under dominion of constantly “needed,” i.e. utility: freedom & magnificence of consumption (Nutzniessung) & its increase

HDG.FS.content: that opposite of monde means impure (immonde) preserves something of Heraclitus’ “world” > fundamental relation of Greek language to nature: leaving nature open in its radiance (Strahlenden) vs. modern era: making nature’s appearances easily calculable
HDG.FS.linkedContent: that opposite of monde means impure (immonde) preserves something of Heraclitus’ “world” > fundamental relation of Greek language to nature: leaving nature open in its radiance (Strahlenden) vs. modern era: making nature’s appearances easily calculable

HDG.FS.content: [technological era] represent world in sequence of its appearances so I can make secure predictions about all/everything
HDG.FS.linkedContent: [technological era] represent world in sequence of its appearances so I can make secure predictions about all/everything

HDG.FS.content: all metaphysics rests on fundamental experience of being specific to thinker: for Kant, experience of being as “Nature” > experience (the key word of CPR), for Kant, in scientific sense, mathematical physics (science par excellence since modern times) > still today, biology becomes biophysics, can predict/prepare mastery of genesis of man, anthropology becomes anthropo-physics, appearance of cybernetics
HDG.FS.linkedContent: all metaphysics rests on fundamental experience of being specific to thinker: for Kant, experience of being as “Nature” > experience (the key word of CPR), for Kant, in scientific sense, mathematical physics (science par excellence since modern times) > still today, biology becomes biophysics, can predict/prepare mastery of genesis of man, anthropology becomes anthropo-physics, appearance of cybernetics

HDG.FS.content: “reflecting-on” requires determined horizon, horizon in which I reflect > we don’t reflect on the Absolute, the Absolute is to be reflected, can’t grasp matter in advance (voraus ergreife), no determinate anticipation (Vor-griff), no perspective to grasp Absolute, all perspective finite > Absolute must be reflected on basis of itself, reflect (mirror) itself for it, bring itself to appearance, such “mirroring” leads to conception of Reason as “speculative” [quite different for Leibniz, where human Reason is the mirror]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: “reflecting-on” requires determined horizon, horizon in which I reflect > we don’t reflect on the Absolute, the Absolute is to be reflected, can’t grasp matter in advance (voraus ergreife), no determinate anticipation (Vor-griff), no perspective to grasp Absolute, all perspective finite > Absolute must be reflected on basis of itself, reflect (mirror) itself for it, bring itself to appearance, such “mirroring” leads to conception of Reason as “speculative” [quite different for Leibniz, where human Reason is the mirror]

HDG.FS.content: Heidegger on physics, orients toward calculability of object [not giving descriptions of nature] [announcement vs. appearance of nature?] > Heisenberg’s universal world formula only analogy: “what one must take into account so that, in any event, one can count on something”
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Heidegger on physics, orients toward calculability of object [not giving descriptions of nature] [announcement vs. appearance of nature?] > Heisenberg’s universal world formula only analogy: “what one must take into account so that, in any event, one can count on something”

HDG.CCP.content: transcendental horizonal re-presenting, horizon/transcendence go/pass beyond object, but only relative to object > horizon still something else besides horizon (beyond its appearance as horizon of our representing), this something else is other side of itself, so same as itself
HDG.CCP.linkedContent: transcendental horizonal re-presenting, horizon/transcendence go/pass beyond object, but only relative to object > horizon still something else besides horizon (beyond its appearance as horizon of our representing), this something else is other side of itself, so same as itself

HDG.DL.content: language beyond expression (Ausdruck), latter understood as sensuous appearance (including phonetic/written formations)
HDG.DL.linkedContent: language beyond expression (Ausdruck), latter understood as sensuous appearance (including phonetic/written formations)

HDG.DL.content: w/ first experience of phenomenon, Greeks didn’t press present beings into opposing objectness (Gegenständigkeit) > phainesthai: a being assumes its radiance (Scheinen), in which it appears (erscheinen) > Das Erscheinen (appearance) still Grundzug of Anwesen von Anwesende, as [beings] rise into unconcealment (Entbergung) ——Heidegger doesn’t think appearance in Greek or Kantian sense > but, what’s decisive (ankommt) [arrival?] is difficult, calls (verlangt) for simple/free vision (Blick)
HDG.DL.linkedContent: w/ first experience of phenomenon, Greeks didn’t press present beings into opposing objectness (Gegenständigkeit) > phainesthai: a being assumes its radiance (Scheinen), in which it appears (erscheinen) > Das Erscheinen (appearance) still Grundzug of Anwesen von Anwesende, as [beings] rise into unconcealment (Entbergung) ——Heidegger doesn’t think appearance in Greek or Kantian sense > but, what’s decisive (ankommt) [arrival?] is difficult, calls (verlangt) for simple/free vision (Blick)

HDG.DL.content: to think Greeks in even more Greek manner doesn’t mean better than them: great thinking understands itself best, i.e. understands itself, w/in limits set for it (zugemessenen Grenzen) > to think more originally than Greeks: to think the unthought clearing (Lichten), the occurrence (Ereignis) [?] of emergence (Hervorkommen) into openness (Lichte) [?], unconcealedness (appearance of that which is present)
HDG.DL.linkedContent: to think Greeks in even more Greek manner doesn’t mean better than them: great thinking understands itself best, i.e. understands itself, w/in limits set for it (zugemessenen Grenzen) > to think more originally than Greeks: to think the unthought clearing (Lichten), the occurrence (Ereignis) [?] of emergence (Hervorkommen) into openness (Lichte) [?], unconcealedness (appearance of that which is present)

HDG.DL.content: no answer will help us, must see (erblicken) appearance as reality (Wesen) of presence (Anwesen) in its essential origin (Wesensherkunft) [no refutation of Greek thought]
HDG.DL.linkedContent: no answer will help us, must see (erblicken) appearance as reality (Wesen) of presence (Anwesen) in its essential origin (Wesensherkunft) [no refutation of Greek thought]

HDG.WL.content: what is unspoken doesn’t just lack voice, it is what remains unsaid (Ungesagte), the not yet shown, that which has yet to reach appearance > that which must remain unspoken is Geheimnis (secret, mystery), abides (verweilt) in concealment as unshowable
HDG.WL.linkedContent: what is unspoken doesn’t just lack voice, it is what remains unsaid (Ungesagte), the not yet shown, that which has yet to reach appearance > that which must remain unspoken is Geheimnis (secret, mystery), abides (verweilt) in concealment as unshowable

HDG.WL.content: Sage: showing, pointing out, signaling (Jean Paul called phenomena of nature “spiritual pointer” or “spiritual index finger”) > Das Wesende der Sprach ist die Sage als die Zeige > in view of Gefüge der Sage, showing not exclusively/decisively property of human activity: Das Sichzeigen kennzeichnet als Erscheinen das An- und Abwesen des Anwesenden jeglicher Art und Stufe [presence still magnetizes presence/absence: self-showing marks the appearance of every kind/rank of presence/absence of all that is present] > even when man accomplishes showing, showing preceded by an indiction that it can be shown [beyond human] > must think of human saying like this to give adequate definition des Wesenden in all speaking
HDG.WL.linkedContent: Sage: showing, pointing out, signaling (Jean Paul called phenomena of nature “spiritual pointer” or “spiritual index finger”) > Das Wesende der Sprach ist die Sage als die Zeige > in view of Gefüge der Sage, showing not exclusively/decisively property of human activity: Das Sichzeigen kennzeichnet als Erscheinen das An- und Abwesen des Anwesenden jeglicher Art und Stufe [presence still magnetizes presence/absence: self-showing marks the appearance of every kind/rank of presence/absence of all that is present] > even when man accomplishes showing, showing preceded by an indiction that it can be shown [beyond human] > must think of human saying like this to give adequate definition des Wesenden in all speaking

HDG.WL.content: showing prevails in Saying, even in everything that waits for us unspoken > Saying not linguistic expression added to phenomenon: all radiant appearance/fading away grounded (beruht) in showing Saying > Saying pervades (durchwaltet)/structures (fügt) openness of clearing (das Freie der Lichtung) that every appearance must seek & every disappearance must leave behind, in which all present/absent being must show/say/announce itself > Saying: the gathering that joins all appearance (alles Scheinen fügende Versammlung), lets all that shows abide w/in itself, the in-itself manifold showing
HDG.WL.linkedContent: showing prevails in Saying, even in everything that waits for us unspoken > Saying not linguistic expression added to phenomenon: all radiant appearance/fading away grounded (beruht) in showing Saying > Saying pervades (durchwaltet)/structures (fügt) openness of clearing (das Freie der Lichtung) that every appearance must seek & every disappearance must leave behind, in which all present/absent being must show/say/announce itself > Saying: the gathering that joins all appearance (alles Scheinen fügende Versammlung), lets all that shows abide w/in itself, the in-itself manifold showing

HDG.WL.content: along the way, what looks like a tangle untangles [arrival?], release/light of way-making movement > movement brings Saying to speech, Saying keeps way open > die Be-wëgung der Sage zur Sprache ist das entbindende Band, das verbindet, indem es er-eignet [bond that binds by appropriating] > language delivered (entbunden) to its own freedom: concerned solely w/ itself > but language as Saying not only self-seeking, the appropriating showing disregards precisely itself, to free what is shown to its proper appearance [withdrawal of language, Saying, Ereignis]
HDG.WL.linkedContent: along the way, what looks like a tangle untangles [arrival?], release/light of way-making movement > movement brings Saying to speech, Saying keeps way open > die Be-wëgung der Sage zur Sprache ist das entbindende Band, das verbindet, indem es er-eignet [bond that binds by appropriating] > language delivered (entbunden) to its own freedom: concerned solely w/ itself > but language as Saying not only self-seeking, the appropriating showing disregards precisely itself, to free what is shown to its proper appearance [withdrawal of language, Saying, Ereignis]

HDG.EC.content: Nietzsche interpreted morality, the Platonic-Christian ethical doctrine, & its later secularized forms (rational Ethics of Enlightenment/socialism), as appearances (Erscheinungen) of will to power > Nietzsche didn’t realize that a will to power “beyond good & evil,” as realm of pure will to power, remains only counter-world (Gegenwelt) to Platonism > Nietzsche’s doctrine of “discipline and breeding (Zucht und Züchtung)” is extreme affirmation of morality > if will is evil, will to power is least of all beyond evil
HDG.EC.linkedContent: Nietzsche interpreted morality, the Platonic-Christian ethical doctrine, & its later secularized forms (rational Ethics of Enlightenment/socialism), as appearances (Erscheinungen) of will to power > Nietzsche didn’t realize that a will to power “beyond good & evil,” as realm of pure will to power, remains only counter-world (Gegenwelt) to Platonism > Nietzsche’s doctrine of “discipline and breeding (Zucht und Züchtung)” is extreme affirmation of morality > if will is evil, will to power is least of all beyond evil

HDG.EC.content: under appearance of secured/improving life, a barring (Verwehrung) of life could occur: the being of all that is, ambiguous (zweideutig) to the core
HDG.EC.linkedContent: under appearance of secured/improving life, a barring (Verwehrung) of life could occur: the being of all that is, ambiguous (zweideutig) to the core

HDG.EC.content: malice of devastation reaches its extreme in appearance of secure state world, standard of living and its realization as highest goal [reaches its extreme in disguise]
HDG.EC.linkedContent: malice of devastation reaches its extreme in appearance of secure state world, standard of living and its realization as highest goal [reaches its extreme in disguise]

HDG.OHF.content: as-what and How of the being-encountered (Begegnens) of what is close to us/given: significance > significant: being, being-there, in How of definite signifying/pointing (bestimmten Be-deutens) > wherein such definiteness consists, How a Dasein announces itself (sich bekundet), needs to be brought out from the concrete [?] > definiteness as disclosedness (Erschlossenheit): 1) availability in advance (Vorhandenheit) 2) advance appearance of a with-world (in dem mitweltlichen Vor-schein)
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: as-what and How of the being-encountered (Begegnens) of what is close to us/given: significance > significant: being, being-there, in How of definite signifying/pointing (bestimmten Be-deutens) > wherein such definiteness consists, How a Dasein announces itself (sich bekundet), needs to be brought out from the concrete [?] > definiteness as disclosedness (Erschlossenheit): 1) availability in advance (Vorhandenheit) 2) advance appearance of a with-world (in dem mitweltlichen Vor-schein)

HDG.OHF.content: Besorgenswege [ways of care]: the beings-which-are-there don’t stand w/in definiteness of definitions, but w/in everydayness & its historicity (Geschichtlichkeit); the there in advance (vorhandene Da) brings the appearance (Vorschein) of “others” into its Dasein > what one-self pursues, that wherein one tarries for a while, one-self (man-selbst) “is” this world: everydayness of Dasein has its Dasein there for itself, seeking it by heeding what others say about it: possibilities of familiarity (of everyday) are factically historical [Mitsein]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: Besorgenswege [ways of care]: the beings-which-are-there don’t stand w/in definiteness of definitions, but w/in everydayness & its historicity (Geschichtlichkeit); the there in advance (vorhandene Da) brings the appearance (Vorschein) of “others” into its Dasein > what one-self pursues, that wherein one tarries for a while, one-self (man-selbst) “is” this world: everydayness of Dasein has its Dasein there for itself, seeking it by heeding what others say about it: possibilities of familiarity (of everyday) are factically historical [Mitsein]

HDG.OHF.content: [encounter others] appearance of a with-world, not object of knowing, but Vorhandenheit > advance appearance (Vorschein) of factical lives of others: “in a with-world” > others encountered in the “with-”world as others bringing w/ them the “one-self”
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [encounter others] appearance of a with-world, not object of knowing, but Vorhandenheit > advance appearance (Vorschein) of factical lives of others: “in a with-world” > others encountered in the “with-”world as others bringing w/ them the “one-self”
